intro: Schizocaena laevigata, commonly known as the smoothleaf schizocaena, is a flowering plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves that are typically smooth and lance-shaped. It produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in clusters, which are often borne on slender pedicels. Schizocaena laevigata is usually found in moist, shaded environments such as forests or along stream banks.
